Milangkala Ke-7 Kabupaten Pangandaran, Seni Tradisional Jadi Penampil Istimewa Napak Jagat Pasundan
04 Nov 2019, 09:14 by Muhammad Fikry Mauludy
RUANG seni tradisional dipilih untuk mengisi panggung utama pada Milangkala Ke-7 Kabupaten Pangandaran. Sejumlah kesenian, termasuk seni tradisional buhun yang selama ini tertidur diangkat menjadi penampil istimewa dalam konsep perayaan meriah, di boulevard Pantai Pangandaran, Minggu, 3 November 2019.
Acara milangkala ini berkonsep karnaval. Peserta pawai yang didukung 10 kecamatan serta rombongan daerah lain di Jawa Barat melakukan parade di jalan utama Pantai Pangandaran. Dari tribun kehormatan, mereka diarahkan menuju panggung Napak Jagat Pasundan, yang dibangun Coklat Kita.
Panggung megah NJP ini menjadi acara puncak Milangkala Ke-7 Kabupaten Pangandaran. Panggung NJP dinilai senafas dengan misi perayaan Ulang Tahun Kabupaten Pangandaran yang menyokong penuh keberadaan seni dan budaya tradisional.
Area NJP yang berkonsep festival ini memberi banyak ruang bagi banyak talenta budaya dari sanggar dan paguron Kabupaten Pangandaran, selain bintang tamu istimewa. Rangkaian acara diisi potensi seni lokal seperti Lingkung Seni Jembar Mustika yang menampilkan kesenian Lebon, Celempung dan Kecapi biola dari Padepokan Dangiang Mustika Sari, serta Sanggar Angklung Mang Koko.
Ada lagi Sanggar Agia dan Sanggar Putra Rengganis yang menampilkan tarian etnik kolaborasi, Sanggar Ligar Munggaran dengan penampilan Eog dan Gondang, Padepokan seni Jenggala Manik yang memainkan Kecapi Rajah Tunggal, serta keahlian dari Kendangers Pangandaran.
Di samping seniman lokal, NJP Pangandaran juga mementaskan Ega Roboth Ethnic Percussion, Jimbot and Friend, Dodi Kiwari, Calung NJP yang berkolaborasi dengan Ohang, serta Abiel Jatnika. NJP yang dimulai sore itu diawali dengan Tari Kreasi dari Ega Roboot Ethnic Percussion di floor area, dan seni Lebon dari Lingkung Seni Jembar Mustika.
Menutup sore, Sanggar Dangiang Mustika Sari membuat pengunjung terkagum dengan permainan apik celempung dan kecapi biolanya. Pasangan MC Prima dan Riva menghidupkan suasana dengan interaksi bersama penonton, yang sesekali menggoda lewat canda.
Malam hari, NJP dilanjut dengan pementasan interaktif dari kolaborasi Kecapi Rajah Tunggal dengan Eog dan Gondang dari Padepokan Seni Jenggala Manik, dan Sanggar Ligar Munggaran di area mini stage NJP.
Setelah itu, panggung utama kembali ramai dengan musik pembuka dari Ega Robot Ethnic Percussion, narasi puisi dari Dodi Kiwari, dan tari etnik kolaborasi Sanggar Algia dan Sanggar Putra Rengganis. Di tengah waktu utama, muncul penampilan angklung Benjang Batok dari Sanggar Mang Koko. Aksi angklung setinggi 5 meter menjadi perhatian warga lokal hingga wisatawan mancanegara yang memadati lapangan.
Penampilan Jimbot & Friend yang berkolaborasi dengan Mang Saswi, Ega Robot Ethnic percussion yang berkolaborasi dengan Kendangers Pangandaran turut memberi energi para penonton. Yang paling ditunggu, calung NJP (Injuk, Junjun, Aep bancet, Aman, Amin) yang berkolaborasi dengan Ohang.
Penampilan mereka diselingin guyonan khas berpadu instrumen musik dan berhasil membuat audiens tertawa lepas. Menutup acara, Abiel Jatnika, putra dari musisi Sunda, Yayan Jatnika tampil membawakan beberapa lagu, termasuk lagu andalan Abiel Jatnika yaitu “Kapalang Nyaah”. 
Acara megah tersaji dari tata suara dan pencahayaan yang mewah. Suara kendang yang terempas dari speaker-speaker besar mampu menggedor jantung penonton. Permainan cahaya ikut memendarkan warna warni kostum penari.



Potensi Wisata
Selain pojok Budaya, pada area festival itu juga berdiri pojok Kaulinan Lembur. Di area itu pengunjung mengantre untuk mencoba bermain beberapa kaulinan lawas seperti menembak target menggunakan bedil karet dan bedil jepret.
Tata letak area festival dibuat nyaman. Sejumlah meja piknik kayu disebar di banyak tempat. Rangkaian lampu pijar membuat suasana malam terasa hangat. Dekorasi booth pendukung sekaligus panggung utama dibalut dekorasi bambu. Di area edukasi, terdapat bangunan lumbung padi (leuit) yang diupayakan sebagai pengingat bagi publik tentang besarnya nilai kearifan lokal Tanah Pasundan.
Ketua DPRD Kabupaten Pangandaran Asep Noordin mengatakan, Coklat Kita telah memberikan dukungan bagi Pangandaran sejak lama, termasuk setiap kegiatan milangkala. NJP juga kerap dihelat di Pangandaran, dengan menampilkan talenta lokal sebagai pemberdayaan sanggar seni Pangandaran.
Kebudayaan yang hampir punah seperti benjang batok yang lama tiarap juga kembali menggeliat dengan adanya ruang besar di panggung NJP. Kampung Ngehen yang menjadi kampung adat kebanggaan Pangandaran ikut bangkit menyambut undangan-undangan mentas.
“Jadi NJP dipilih di acara puncak itu karena selama ini mendapat apresiasi positif dari sanggar-sanggar seni yang dilibatkan. Bahkan kami 2020 terinspirasi NJP akan membuat kegiatan yang mirip dengan NJP di 10 kecamatan dengan nama‘Ngariksa Jagat Nguriling ka Tepis Wiring’. Insyaallah tahun 2020 bisa didukung Coklat Kita, mudah-mudahan bisa disinergikan,” ujarnya.
Perwakilan DSO Coklat Kita Kota Banjar Giwa Rahman menjelaskan, potensi Pangandaran bisa menyaingi Bali yang kuat dengan budayanya jika terus digali dan diberi ruang. Coklat Kita terus menciptakan medium acara agar kesenian tradisional bisa menjadi penampil utama di panggung-panggung publik. Selama ini, Coklat Kita terus menggelar acara di Pangandaran seperti, Gunem Catur, Lembur Kuring, Kamonesan 1 dan 2, Hariring, dengan NJP sebagai puncak acara. 
“Edisi khusus di Pangandaran ini kita akan menampilkan potensi seni Pangandaran untuk tampil. Kenapa disebut edisi khusus, karena ini khusus permintaan bupati agar publik dan wisatawan bisa memberikan apresiasi luar biasa bagi potensi budaya lokal,” katanya.
Perwakilan Coklat Kita RSO Bandung Ariella Davina menambahkan, Coklat Kita Napak Jagat Pasundan tidak hanya sekadar tontonan semata. Coklat Kita, yang kali ini bekerja sama dengan Pemkab Pangandaran berkomitmen untuk tetap melestarikan seni dan budaya. Yang tidak kalah penting yakni dukungan bagi para seniman, sanggar, serta paguron, yang berjasa memelihara tradisi Jawa Barat.
“Harapan kami, seni budaya tatar Pasundan bisa selalu bertahan dan tetap kokoh seiring perkembangan zaman, dan menjadi salah satu value untuk pariwisatanya.Kalau bukan kita yang notabene adalah masyarakat daerah, siapa lagi yang akan melestarikan dan mengembangkan aset budya milik kita,” ujarnya.***

The 7th Milestone of Pangandaran Regency, Traditional Art Becomes Special Performance of Pasundan Jagat Napak
Nov 04 2019, 09:14 by Muhammad Fikry Mauludy
The traditional arts room was chosen to fill the main stage of the 7th Milangkala of Pangandaran Regency. A number of arts, including traditional arts buhun who had been asleep was appointed as a special performer in the concept of a festive celebration, on the boulevard of Pangandaran Beach, Sunday, November 3, 2019.
This event is sometimes a carnival concept. Participants in the parade supported by 10 sub-districts and other regional groups in West Java parade on the main street of Pangandaran Beach. From the honorary stand, they were directed towards the Napak Jagat Pasundan stage, which was built by Cok Kita.
This magnificent NJP stage was the highlight of the 7th Milangkala Pangandaran Regency. The NJP stage is considered to be in line with the mission of celebrating the Birthday of Pangandaran Regency which fully supports the existence of traditional arts and culture.
The NJP area with the concept of this festival gives plenty of room for many cultural talents from the studio and paguron of Pangandaran Regency, in addition to special guest stars. The series of events filled with local art potential such as the Mustika Twin Art Circle which featured the arts of Lebon, Celempung and Kecapi violin from Padepokan Dangiang Mustika Sari, and Angklung Mang Koko Studio.
There is another Sanggar Agia and Sanggar Putra Rengganis, which features collaborative ethnic dances, Sanggar Ligar Munggaran with Eog and Gondang performances, Padepokan Manik Jenggala art that plays Kecapi Rajah Tunggal, and expertise from Kendangers Pangandaran.
Besides local artists, NJP Pangandaran also performed Ega Roboth Ethnic Percussion, Jimbot and Friend, Dodi Kiwari, NJP Calung who collaborated with Ohang, and Abiel Jatnika. The NJP that began that afternoon began with the Creative Dance of Ega Roboot Ethnic Percussion on the floor area, and Lebon art from the Mustika Twin Art Circle.
Closing the afternoon, Dangiang Mustika Sari Studio made visitors amazed by the slick playing of zither and violin. The couple Prima MC and Riva liven up the atmosphere with interaction with the audience, who occasionally teased through jokes.
In the evening, NJP was continued with an interactive performance from the collaboration of Kecapi Rajah Tunggal with Eog and Gondang from Padepokan Seni Jenggala Manik, and Sanggar Ligar Munggaran in the NJP mini stage area.
After that, the main stage was again crowded with opening music from Ega Robot Ethnic Percussion, poetry narration from Dodi Kiwari, and collaborative ethnic dance Sanggar Algia and Sanggar Putra Rengganis. In the middle of the main time, the appearance of angklung Benjang Batok from Sanggar Mang Koko. Angklung action as high as 5 meters became the attention of local residents to foreign tourists who packed the field.
Jimbot & Friend's collaboration with Mang Saswi, Ega Robot Ethnic percussion who collaborated with Kendangers Pangandaran also energized the audience. The most awaited, calung NJP (Injuk, Junjun, Aep bancet, Aman, Amin) who collaborated with Ohang.
Their appearance was accompanied by a unique joke combined with musical instruments and managed to make the audience laugh out loud. Closing the event, Abiel Jatnika, the son of Sundanese musician, Yayan Jatnika, performed several songs, including Abiel Jatnika's flagship song, "Kapalang Nyaah".
The majestic program is presented by sound and luxurious lighting. The sound of the drum being blown away from the large speakers is capable of banging on the hearts of the audience. The play of light helps to color the dancers' colorful costumes.



Tourism Potential
In addition to the Cultural Corner, the festival area also stands the Overtime Kaulinan Corner. In that area visitors lined up to try to play some old legions such as shooting targets using rubber guns and shot guns.
The layout of the festival area is made comfortable. A number of wooden picnic tables are distributed in many places. A series of incandescent lamps makes the night atmosphere feel warm. Supporting booth decorations as well as the main stage are clad in bamboo decorations. In the education area, there is a rice barn building (leuit) which is sought as a reminder to the public about the magnitude of the local wisdom value of Pasundan Land.
Pangandaran Regency DPRD Chairperson Asep Noordin said, Chocolate We have provided support for Pangandaran for a long time, including every occasional activity. NJP is also often held in Pangandaran, by presenting local talents as the empowerment of Pangandaran art studio.
Nearly extinct cultures such as the long-lying coconut shell have also been stretched back by the existence of a large space on the NJP stage. Ngehen village, a traditional village of Pangandaran's pride, rose up to welcome Mentas invitations.
"So NJP was chosen at the top event because so far it has received positive appreciation from the art galleries involved. Even our 2020 inspired NJP will make activities similar to NJP in 10 districts with the name "Ngatiling Jagat Nguriling ka Tepis Wiring". God willing, 2020 can be supported by Kita Chocolate, hopefully it can be synergized, "he said.
Representative of the DSO of Cok Kita, Banjar City, Giwa Rahman, explained that the potential of Pangandaran could rival a strong Bali with its culture if it continued to be dug up and given space. Chocolate We continue to create a medium for events so that traditional arts can become the main performers on public stages. During this time, Coklat Kita continues to hold events in Pangandaran such as, Chess Gunem, Curing Overtime, Kamonesan 1 and 2, Hariring, with NJP as the highlight of the event.
"This special edition in Pangandaran will show the potential of Pangandaran art to perform. Why is it called a special edition, because this is a special request from the regent so that the public and tourists can provide extraordinary appreciation for the potential of local culture, "he said.
Representative of the Chocolate Kita Bandung RSO Ariella Davina added, Chocolate Kita Napak Jagat Pasundan is not just mere spectacle. Chocolate Kita, who this time is working with the Pangandaran Regency Government is committed to continuing to preserve art and culture. No less important is the support for artists, studios and paguron, who are credited with preserving the traditions of West Java.
"Our hope is that the art and culture of the Pasundan Tatars can always survive and remain strong along with the times, and become one of the values for tourism. ***
